posts.post_content: For 2 mana, with the restrictions on when you can play it, +1/+1 isn't enough. Add in the coin-flip to get the effect, and it's clear this needs to give at least a +3/+3 bonus. Perhaps +3/+3 with "if you lose the flip, return this card to your hand at end of turn", or a straight +1/+1 with "if you win the flip, that creature gets an aditional +2/+2".

posts.post_content:
What a needlessly convoluted [Feral Instinct](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Feral Instinct). Considering that Feral Instinct was printed in the next set, it's baffling why they went and printed this card, as it's nearly strictly-worse.
  
   
Even Chance Encounter decks have better options than this. It's funny that the champion coin-flipper himself ([Frenetic Efreet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frenetic Efreet)) is in this exact same set.

@scumbling1: Comparing green spells to red spells is like comparing apples to oranges. Green is a combat trick master, from the get go they had Giant Growth and Berserk. Red is burn master and red combat effects are normally plain to see.

But WoTc has fumbled this twice: if only they used +2/+2 and we'd look this card differently.

Funny that it's C U M that's censored not S C U M.
